title: Writing Education Design and Evaluation Using Computer-Aided Investigative Analysis Tools

context.prior_knowledge: Basic academic writing skills and fundamental understanding of digital tools
context.additional_context: Modular design integrable into university undergraduate foundational writing curricula, focusing on visualizing and evaluating rhetorical patterns through academic and non-academic text analysis

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the rhetorical structure of texts using computer-assisted discourse analysis tools such as DocuScope.
Learners can identify and comparatively explain rhetorical patterns in academic and non-academic genre-specific writing.
Learners can improve their writing strategies and incorporate feedback based on data extracted from analytical tools.

resources: DocuScope or Similar Rhetorical Analysis Tool License
Online Collaboration Platforms (e.g., Google Docs, Padlet)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
